intro: Leucothrinax, commonly known as the false palm, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Arecaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. These plants are characterized by their tall, slender stems and pinnate leaves that resemble those of true palms. They produce small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, followed by bright red fruits. Leucothrinax species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
